result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:38 AM Defendant Adrian J Buckowing in court, via Zoom.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Adrian J Buckowing.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  State has tendered an offer.  Defense is rejecting the offer.  State asks for a trial date.  All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial.  Parties are to check for witness availability for this scheduled trial date and inform the Court of any problems. BTC: Deft. can appear via Zoom for the next status.  Deft. to be in person for the FPT and JT.
Jury trial scheduled for February 21, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on February 6, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial on February 21, 2023 at 08:30 am.
requesting Zoom appearance

Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defense requests the defendant be allowed to appear via Zoom based on the defendant residing in Michigan, the State does not object.  The court will allow this one time, this will need to be reviewed by Judge Gasiorkiewicz and a hearing by hearing basis.

NG plea entered.

$7,500 SIGNATURE BOND

***ALSO $7500.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.A.R, M.R, OR J.A.B(person, property, residence or family). You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.

BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
